page.title: 15Nettleworth Manor
page.content: It was built for William Wilde, a rich merchant in 1566. We discovered that he invented a metal tipped arrow which was used in the Armada in 1588. The manor itself is now in a state of decay. The main farmhouse, now in use was built in 1936.The present owners, the Beard family, bought the farmhouse in 1945.The manor consists of 98 acres which is mainly used as a market garden. There are 6 greenhouses which contain 41 varieties of bedding plants. There are approximately 700 seed trays, each containing 5 punnets of a dozen seedlings.They also produce 4 varieties of tomatoes:-Ailsa Craig, Alicante, Moneymaker, Money Cross.They have about 2,500 of each variety. The greenhouses also contain 200 female cucumbers.The manor also supports 40 beef cattle and the main crops this year are barley,hay & a little wheat.
